044package org.jfree.chart.plot;
045
046import java.awt.AlphaComposite;
047import java.awt.BasicStroke;
048import java.awt.Color;
049import java.awt.Composite;
050import java.awt.Font;
051import java.awt.GradientPaint;
052import java.awt.Graphics2D;
053import java.awt.Image;
054import java.awt.Paint;
055import java.awt.RenderingHints;
056import java.awt.Shape;
057import java.awt.Stroke;
058import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
059import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
060import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
061import java.io.IOException;
062import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
063import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
064import java.io.Serializable;
065import java.util.Objects;
066
067import javax.swing.event.EventListenerList;
068import org.jfree.chart.ChartElement;
069import org.jfree.chart.ChartElementVisitor;
070
071import org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart;
072import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItemCollection;
073import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItemSource;
074import org.jfree.chart.annotations.Annotation;
075import org.jfree.chart.axis.AxisLocation;
076import org.jfree.chart.entity.EntityCollection;
077import org.jfree.chart.entity.PlotEntity;
078import org.jfree.chart.event.AnnotationChangeEvent;
079import org.jfree.chart.event.AnnotationChangeListener;
080import org.jfree.chart.event.AxisChangeEvent;
081import org.jfree.chart.event.AxisChangeListener;
082import org.jfree.chart.event.ChartChangeEventType;
083import org.jfree.chart.event.MarkerChangeEvent;
084import org.jfree.chart.event.MarkerChangeListener;
085import org.jfree.chart.event.PlotChangeEvent;
086import org.jfree.chart.event.PlotChangeListener;
087import org.jfree.chart.text.G2TextMeasurer;
088import org.jfree.chart.text.TextBlock;
089import org.jfree.chart.text.TextBlockAnchor;
090import org.jfree.chart.text.TextUtils;
091import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleEdge;
092import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleInsets;
093import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
094import org.jfree.chart.internal.CloneUtils;
095import org.jfree.chart.internal.PaintUtils;
096import org.jfree.chart.api.PublicCloneable;
097import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleAlignment;
098import org.jfree.chart.internal.SerialUtils;
099import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetChangeEvent;
100import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetChangeListener;
101
102/**
103 * The base class for all plots in JFreeChart.  The {@link JFreeChart} class
104 * delegates the drawing of axes and data to the plot.  This base class
105 * provides facilities common to most plot types.
106 */
107public abstract class Plot implements ChartElement, AxisChangeListener,
108        DatasetChangeListener, AnnotationChangeListener, MarkerChangeListener,
109        LegendItemSource, PublicCloneable, Cloneable, Serializable {
110
111    private transient PlotProduct2 plotProduct2 = new PlotProduct2();
112
113        private PlotProduct plotProduct = new PlotProduct();
114
115        /** For serialization. */
116    private static final long serialVersionUID = -8831571430103671324L;
117
118    /** Useful constant representing zero. */
119    public static final Number ZERO = 0;
120
121    /** The default insets. */
122    public static final RectangleInsets DEFAULT_INSETS
123            = new RectangleInsets(4.0, 8.0, 4.0, 8.0);
124
125    /** The default outline stroke. */
126    public static final Stroke DEFAULT_OUTLINE_STROKE = new BasicStroke(0.5f,
127            BasicStroke.CAP_ROUND, BasicStroke.JOIN_ROUND);
128
129    /** The default outline color. */
130    public static final Paint DEFAULT_OUTLINE_PAINT = Color.GRAY;
131
132    /** The default foreground alpha transparency. */
133    public static final float DEFAULT_FOREGROUND_ALPHA = 1.0f;
134
135    /** The default background alpha transparency. */
136    public static final float DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_ALPHA = 1.0f;
137
138    /** The default background color. */
139    public static final Paint DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_PAINT = Color.WHITE;
140
141    /** The minimum width at which the plot should be drawn. */
142    public static final int MINIMUM_WIDTH_TO_DRAW = 10;
143
144    /** The minimum height at which the plot should be drawn. */
145    public static final int MINIMUM_HEIGHT_TO_DRAW = 10;
146
147    /** A default box shape for legend items. */
148    public static final Shape DEFAULT_LEGEND_ITEM_BOX
149            = new Rectangle2D.Double(-4.0, -4.0, 8.0, 8.0);
150
151    /** A default circle shape for legend items. */
152    public static final Shape DEFAULT_LEGEND_ITEM_CIRCLE
153            = new Ellipse2D.Double(-4.0, -4.0, 8.0, 8.0);
154
155    /** 
156     * The chart that the plot is assigned to.  It can be {@code null} if the
157     * plot is not assigned to a chart yet, or if the plot is a subplot of a
158     * another plot.
159     */
160    private JFreeChart chart;
161    
162    /** The parent plot ({@code null} if this is the root plot). */
163    private Plot parent;
164
165    /** The message to display if no data is available. */
166    private String noDataMessage;
167
168    /** The font used to display the 'no data' message. */
169    private Font noDataMessageFont;
170
171    /** The paint used to draw the 'no data' message. */
172    private transient Paint noDataMessagePaint;
173
174    /** Amount of blank space around the plot area. */
175    private RectangleInsets insets;
176
177    /**
178     * A flag that controls whether or not the plot outline is drawn.
179     */
180    private boolean outlineVisible;
181
182    /** The Stroke used to draw an outline around the plot. */
183    private transient Stroke outlineStroke;
184
185    /** The Paint used to draw an outline around the plot. */
186    private transient Paint outlinePaint;
187
188    /** An optional color used to fill the plot background. */
189    private transient Paint backgroundPaint;
190
191    /** The alpha-transparency for the plot. */
192    private float foregroundAlpha;
193
194    /** The alpha transparency for the background paint. */
195    private float backgroundAlpha;
196
197    /** The drawing supplier. */
198    private DrawingSupplier drawingSupplier;
199
200    /**
201     * A flag that controls whether or not the plot will notify listeners
202     * of changes (defaults to true, but sometimes it is useful to disable
203     * this).
204     */
205    private boolean notify;
206
207    /**
208     * Creates a new plot.
209     */
210    protected Plot() {
211        this.chart = null;
212        this.parent = null;
213        this.insets = DEFAULT_INSETS;
214        this.backgroundPaint = DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_PAINT;
215        this.backgroundAlpha = DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_ALPHA;
216        plotProduct.setBackgroundImage2(null);
217        this.outlineVisible = true;
218        this.outlineStroke = DEFAULT_OUTLINE_STROKE;
219        this.outlinePaint = DEFAULT_OUTLINE_PAINT;
220        this.foregroundAlpha = DEFAULT_FOREGROUND_ALPHA;
221
222        this.noDataMessage = null;
223        this.noDataMessageFont = new Font("SansSerif", Font.PLAIN, 12);
224        this.noDataMessagePaint = Color.BLACK;
225
226        this.drawingSupplier = new DefaultDrawingSupplier();
227
228        this.notify = true;
229        plotProduct2.setListenerList(new EventListenerList());
230    }
231    
232    /**
233     * Returns the chart that this plot is assigned to.  This method can
234     * return {@code null} if the plot is not yet assigned to a plot, or if the
235     * plot is a subplot of another plot.
236     * 
237     * @return The chart (possibly {@code null}).
238     */
239    public JFreeChart getChart() {
240        return this.chart;
241    }
242    
243    /**
244     * Sets the chart that the plot is assigned to.  This method is not 
245     * intended for external use.
246     * 
247     * @param chart  the chart ({@code null} permitted).
248     */
249    public void setChart(JFreeChart chart) {
250        this.chart = chart;
251    }
252    
253    /**
254     * Fetches the element hinting flag from the chart that this plot is 
255     * assigned to.  If the plot is not assigned (directly or indirectly) to
256     * a chart instance, this method will return {@code false}.
257     * 
258     * @return A boolean.
259     */
260    public boolean fetchElementHintingFlag() {
261        if (this.parent != null) {
262            return this.parent.fetchElementHintingFlag();
263        }
264        if (this.chart != null) {
265            return this.chart.getElementHinting();
266        }
267        return false;
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Returns the string that is displayed when the dataset is empty or
272     * {@code null}.
273     *
274     * @return The 'no data' message ({@code null} possible).
275     *
276     * @see #setNoDataMessage(String)
277     * @see #getNoDataMessageFont()
278     * @see #getNoDataMessagePaint()
279     */
280    public String getNoDataMessage() {
281        return this.noDataMessage;
282    }
283
284    /**
285     * Sets the message that is displayed when the dataset is empty or
286     * {@code null}, and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered
287     * listeners.
288     *
289     * @param message  the message ({@code null} permitted).
290     *
291     * @see #getNoDataMessage()
292     */
293    public void setNoDataMessage(String message) {
294        this.noDataMessage = message;
295        fireChangeEvent();
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Returns the font used to display the 'no data' message.
300     *
301     * @return The font (never {@code null}).
302     *
303     * @see #setNoDataMessageFont(Font)
304     * @see #getNoDataMessage()
305     */
306    public Font getNoDataMessageFont() {
307        return this.noDataMessageFont;
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Sets the font used to display the 'no data' message and sends a
312     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
313     *
314     * @param font  the font ({@code null} not permitted).
315     *
316     * @see #getNoDataMessageFont()
317     */
318    public void setNoDataMessageFont(Font font) {
319        Args.nullNotPermitted(font, "font");
320        this.noDataMessageFont = font;
321        fireChangeEvent();
322    }
323
324    /**
325     * Returns the paint used to display the 'no data' message.
326     *
327     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
328     *
329     * @see #setNoDataMessagePaint(Paint)
330     * @see #getNoDataMessage()
331     */
332    public Paint getNoDataMessagePaint() {
333        return this.noDataMessagePaint;
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * Sets the paint used to display the 'no data' message and sends a
338     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
339     *
340     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} not permitted).
341     *
342     * @see #getNoDataMessagePaint()
343     */
344    public void setNoDataMessagePaint(Paint paint) {
345        Args.nullNotPermitted(paint, "paint");
346        this.noDataMessagePaint = paint;
347        fireChangeEvent();
348    }
349
350    /**
351     * Returns a short string describing the plot type.
352     * <P>
353     * Note: this gets used in the chart property editing user interface,
354     * but there needs to be a better mechanism for identifying the plot type.
355     *
356     * @return A short string describing the plot type (never
357     *     {@code null}).
358     */
359    public abstract String getPlotType();
360
361    /**
362     * Returns the parent plot (or {@code null} if this plot is not part
363     * of a combined plot).
364     *
365     * @return The parent plot.
366     *
367     * @see #setParent(Plot)
368     * @see #getRootPlot()
369     */
370    public Plot getParent() {
371        return this.parent;
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * Sets the parent plot.  This method is intended for internal use, you
376     * shouldn't need to call it directly.
377     *
378     * @param parent  the parent plot ({@code null} permitted).
379     *
380     * @see #getParent()
381     */
382    public void setParent(Plot parent) {
383        this.parent = parent;
384    }
385
386    /**
387     * Returns the root plot.
388     *
389     * @return The root plot.
390     *
391     * @see #getParent()
392     */
393    public Plot getRootPlot() {
394
395        Plot p = getParent();
396        if (p == null) {
397            return this;
398        }
399        return p.getRootPlot();
400
401    }
402
403    /**
404     * Returns {@code true} if this plot is part of a combined plot
405     * structure (that is, {@link #getParent()} returns a non-{@code null}
406     * value), and {@code false} otherwise.
407     *
408     * @return {@code true} if this plot is part of a combined plot
409     *         structure.
410     *
411     * @see #getParent()
412     */
413    public boolean isSubplot() {
414        return (getParent() != null);
415    }
416
417    /**
418     * Returns the insets for the plot area.
419     *
420     * @return The insets (never {@code null}).
421     *
422     * @see #setInsets(RectangleInsets)
423     */
424    public RectangleInsets getInsets() {
425        return this.insets;
426    }
427
428    /**
429     * Sets the insets for the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to
430     * all registered listeners.
431     *
432     * @param insets  the new insets ({@code null} not permitted).
433     *
434     * @see #getInsets()
435     * @see #setInsets(RectangleInsets, boolean)
436     */
437    public void setInsets(RectangleInsets insets) {
438        setInsets(insets, true);
439    }
440
441    /**
442     * Sets the insets for the plot and, if requested,  and sends a
443     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
444     *
445     * @param insets  the new insets ({@code null} not permitted).
446     * @param notify  a flag that controls whether the registered listeners are
447     *                notified.
448     *
449     * @see #getInsets()
450     * @see #setInsets(RectangleInsets)
451     */
452    public void setInsets(RectangleInsets insets, boolean notify) {
453        Args.nullNotPermitted(insets, "insets");
454        if (!this.insets.equals(insets)) {
455            this.insets = insets;
456            if (notify) {
457                fireChangeEvent();
458            }
459        }
460
461    }
462
463    /**
464     * Returns the background color of the plot area.
465     *
466     * @return The paint (possibly {@code null}).
467     *
468     * @see #setBackgroundPaint(Paint)
469     */
470    public Paint getBackgroundPaint() {
471        return this.backgroundPaint;
472    }
473
474    /**
475     * Sets the background color of the plot area and sends a
476     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
477     *
478     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} permitted).
479     *
480     * @see #getBackgroundPaint()
481     */
482    public void setBackgroundPaint(Paint paint) {
483
484        if (paint == null) {
485            if (this.backgroundPaint != null) {
486                this.backgroundPaint = null;
487                fireChangeEvent();
488            }
489        }
490        else {
491            if (this.backgroundPaint != null) {
492                if (this.backgroundPaint.equals(paint)) {
493                    return;  // nothing to do
494                }
495            }
496            this.backgroundPaint = paint;
497            fireChangeEvent();
498        }
499
500    }
501
502    /**
503     * Returns the alpha transparency of the plot area background.
504     *
505     * @return The alpha transparency.
506     *
507     * @see #setBackgroundAlpha(float)
508     */
509    public float getBackgroundAlpha() {
510        return this.backgroundAlpha;
511    }
512
513    /**
514     * Sets the alpha transparency of the plot area background, and notifies
515     * registered listeners that the plot has been modified.
516     *
517     * @param alpha the new alpha value (in the range 0.0f to 1.0f).
518     *
519     * @see #getBackgroundAlpha()
520     */
521    public void setBackgroundAlpha(float alpha) {
522        if (this.backgroundAlpha != alpha) {
523            this.backgroundAlpha = alpha;
524            fireChangeEvent();
525        }
526    }
527
528    /**
529     * Returns the drawing supplier for the plot.
530     *
531     * @return The drawing supplier (possibly {@code null}).
532     *
533     * @see #setDrawingSupplier(DrawingSupplier)
534     */
535    public DrawingSupplier getDrawingSupplier() {
536        DrawingSupplier result;
537        Plot p = getParent();
538        if (p != null) {
539            result = p.getDrawingSupplier();
540        }
541        else {
542            result = this.drawingSupplier;
543        }
544        return result;
545    }
546
547    /**
548     * Sets the drawing supplier for the plot and sends a
549     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  The drawing
550     * supplier is responsible for supplying a limitless (possibly repeating)
551     * sequence of {@code Paint}, {@code Stroke} and
552     * {@code Shape} objects that the plot's renderer(s) can use to
553     * populate its (their) tables.
554     *
555     * @param supplier  the new supplier.
556     *
557     * @see #getDrawingSupplier()
558     */
559    public void setDrawingSupplier(DrawingSupplier supplier) {
560        this.drawingSupplier = supplier;
561        fireChangeEvent();
562    }
563
564    /**
565     * Sets the drawing supplier for the plot and, if requested, sends a
566     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  The drawing
567     * supplier is responsible for supplying a limitless (possibly repeating)
568     * sequence of {@code Paint}, {@code Stroke} and
569     * {@code Shape} objects that the plot's renderer(s) can use to
570     * populate its (their) tables.
571     *
572     * @param supplier  the new supplier.
573     * @param notify  notify listeners?
574     *
575     * @see #getDrawingSupplier()
576     */
577    public void setDrawingSupplier(DrawingSupplier supplier, boolean notify) {
578        this.drawingSupplier = supplier;
579        if (notify) {
580            fireChangeEvent();
581        }
582    }
583
584    /**
585     * Returns the background image that is used to fill the plot's background
586     * area.
587     *
588     * @return The image (possibly {@code null}).
589     *
590     * @see #setBackgroundImage(Image)
591     */
592    public Image getBackgroundImage() {
593        return this.plotProduct.getBackgroundImage();
594    }
595
596    /**
597     * Sets the background image for the plot and sends a
598     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
599     *
600     * @param image  the image ({@code null} permitted).
601     *
602     * @see #getBackgroundImage()
603     */
604    public void setBackgroundImage(Image image) {
605        plotProduct.setBackgroundImage(image, this);
606    }
607
608    /**
609     * Returns the background image alignment. The default value is 
610     * {@code RectangleAlignment.FILL}.
611     *
612     * @return The alignment (never {@code null}).
613     *
614     * @see #setBackgroundImageAlignment(RectangleAlignment)
615     */
616    public RectangleAlignment getBackgroundImageAlignment() {
617        return this.plotProduct.getBackgroundImageAlignment();
618    }
619
620    /**
621     * Sets the alignment for the background image and sends a
622     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  
623     *
624     * @param alignment  the alignment ({@code null} not permitted).
625     *
626     * @see #getBackgroundImageAlignment()
627     */
628    public void setBackgroundImageAlignment(RectangleAlignment alignment) {
629        plotProduct.setBackgroundImageAlignment(alignment, this);
630    }
631
632    /**
633     * Returns the alpha transparency used to draw the background image.  This
634     * is a value in the range 0.0f to 1.0f, where 0.0f is fully transparent
635     * and 1.0f is fully opaque.
636     *
637     * @return The alpha transparency.
638     *
639     * @see #setBackgroundImageAlpha(float)
640     */
641    public float getBackgroundImageAlpha() {
642        return this.plotProduct.getBackgroundImageAlpha();
643    }
644
645    /**
646     * Sets the alpha transparency used when drawing the background image.
647     *
648     * @param alpha  the alpha transparency (in the range 0.0f to 1.0f, where
649     *     0.0f is fully transparent, and 1.0f is fully opaque).
650     *
651     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code alpha} is not within
652     *     the specified range.
653     *
654     * @see #getBackgroundImageAlpha()
655     */
656    public void setBackgroundImageAlpha(float alpha) {
657        plotProduct.setBackgroundImageAlpha(alpha, this);
658    }
659
660    /**
661     * Returns the flag that controls whether or not the plot outline is
662     * drawn.  The default value is {@code true}.  Note that for
663     * historical reasons, the plot's outline paint and stroke can take on
664     * {@code null} values, in which case the outline will not be drawn
665     * even if this flag is set to {@code true}.
666     *
667     * @return The outline visibility flag.
668     *
669     * @see #setOutlineVisible(boolean)
670     */
671    public boolean isOutlineVisible() {
672        return this.outlineVisible;
673    }
674
675    /**
676     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not the plot's outline is
677     * drawn, and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
678     *
679     * @param visible  the new flag value.
680     *
681     * @see #isOutlineVisible()
682     */
683    public void setOutlineVisible(boolean visible) {
684        this.outlineVisible = visible;
685        fireChangeEvent();
686    }
687
688    /**
689     * Returns the stroke used to outline the plot area.
690     *
691     * @return The stroke (possibly {@code null}).
692     *
693     * @see #setOutlineStroke(Stroke)
694     */
695    public Stroke getOutlineStroke() {
696        return this.outlineStroke;
697    }
698
699    /**
700     * Sets the stroke used to outline the plot area and sends a
701     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners. If you set this
702     * attribute to {@code null}, no outline will be drawn.
703     *
704     * @param stroke  the stroke ({@code null} permitted).
705     *
706     * @see #getOutlineStroke()
707     */
708    public void setOutlineStroke(Stroke stroke) {
709        if (stroke == null) {
710            if (this.outlineStroke != null) {
711                this.outlineStroke = null;
712                fireChangeEvent();
713            }
714        }
715        else {
716            if (this.outlineStroke != null) {
717                if (this.outlineStroke.equals(stroke)) {
718                    return;  // nothing to do
719                }
720            }
721            this.outlineStroke = stroke;
722            fireChangeEvent();
723        }
724    }
725
726    /**
727     * Returns the color used to draw the outline of the plot area.
728     *
729     * @return The color (possibly {@code null}).
730     *
731     * @see #setOutlinePaint(Paint)
732     */
733    public Paint getOutlinePaint() {
734        return this.outlinePaint;
735    }
736
737    /**
738     * Sets the paint used to draw the outline of the plot area and sends a
739     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  If you set this
740     * attribute to {@code null}, no outline will be drawn.
741     *
742     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} permitted).
743     *
744     * @see #getOutlinePaint()
745     */
746    public void setOutlinePaint(Paint paint) {
747        if (paint == null) {
748            if (this.outlinePaint != null) {
749                this.outlinePaint = null;
750                fireChangeEvent();
751            }
752        }
753        else {
754            if (this.outlinePaint != null) {
755                if (this.outlinePaint.equals(paint)) {
756                    return;  // nothing to do
757                }
758            }
759            this.outlinePaint = paint;
760            fireChangeEvent();
761        }
762    }
763
764    /**
765     * Returns the alpha-transparency for the plot foreground.
766     *
767     * @return The alpha-transparency.
768     *
769     * @see #setForegroundAlpha(float)
770     */
771    public float getForegroundAlpha() {
772        return this.foregroundAlpha;
773    }
774
775    /**
776     * Sets the alpha-transparency for the plot and sends a
777     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
778     *
779     * @param alpha  the new alpha transparency.
780     *
781     * @see #getForegroundAlpha()
782     */
783    public void setForegroundAlpha(float alpha) {
784        if (this.foregroundAlpha != alpha) {
785            this.foregroundAlpha = alpha;
786            fireChangeEvent();
787        }
788    }
789
790    /**
791     * Returns the legend items for the plot.  By default, this method returns
792     * {@code null}.  Subclasses should override to return a
793     * {@link LegendItemCollection}.
794     *
795     * @return The legend items for the plot (possibly {@code null}).
796     */
797    @Override
798    public LegendItemCollection getLegendItems() {
799        return null;
800    }
801
802    /**
803     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not change events are sent to
804     * registered listeners.
805     *
806     * @return A boolean.
807     *
808     * @see #setNotify(boolean)
809     */
810    public boolean isNotify() {
811        return this.notify;
812    }
813
814    /**
815     * Sets a flag that controls whether or not listeners receive
816     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} notifications.
817     *
818     * @param notify  a boolean.
819     *
820     * @see #isNotify()
821     */
822    public void setNotify(boolean notify) {
823        plotProduct2.setNotify(notify, this);
824    }
825
826    /**
827     * Registers an object for notification of changes to the plot.
828     *
829     * @param listener  the object to be registered.
830     *
831     * @see #removeChangeListener(PlotChangeListener)
832     */
833    public void addChangeListener(PlotChangeListener listener) {
834        plotProduct2.addChangeListener(listener);
835    }
836
837    /**
838     * Unregisters an object for notification of changes to the plot.
839     *
840     * @param listener  the object to be unregistered.
841     *
842     * @see #addChangeListener(PlotChangeListener)
843     */
844    public void removeChangeListener(PlotChangeListener listener) {
845        plotProduct2.removeChangeListener(listener);
846    }
847
848    /**
849     * Notifies all registered listeners that the plot has been modified.
850     *
851     * @param event  information about the change event.
852     */
853    public void notifyListeners(PlotChangeEvent event) {
854        plotProduct2.notifyListeners(event, this);
855    }
856
857    /**
858     * Sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
859     */
860    protected void fireChangeEvent() {
861        plotProduct2.notifyListeners(new PlotChangeEvent(this), this);
862    }
863
864    /**
865     * Receives a chart element visitor.  Many plot subclasses will override
866     * this method to handle their subcomponents.
867     * 
868     * @param visitor  the visitor ({@code null} not permitted).
869     */
870    @Override
871    public void receive(ChartElementVisitor visitor) {
872        visitor.visit(this);
873    }
874
875    /**
876     * Draws the plot within the specified area.  The anchor is a point on the
877     * chart that is specified externally (for instance, it may be the last
878     * point of the last mouse click performed by the user) - plots can use or
879     * ignore this value as they see fit.
880     * <br><br>
881     * Subclasses need to provide an implementation of this method, obviously.
882     *
883     * @param g2  the graphics device.
884     * @param area  the plot area.
885     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
886     * @param parentState  the parent state (if any, {@code null} permitted).
887     * @param info  carries back plot rendering info.
888     */
889    public abstract void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
890            PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo info);
891
892    /**
893     * Draws the plot background (the background color and/or image).
894     * <P>
895     * This method will be called during the chart drawing process and is
896     * declared public so that it can be accessed by the renderers used by
897     * certain subclasses.  You shouldn't need to call this method directly.
898     *
899     * @param g2  the graphics device.
900     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
901     */
902    public void drawBackground(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
903        // some subclasses override this method completely, so don't put
904        // anything here that *must* be done
905        fillBackground(g2, area);
906        plotProduct.drawBackgroundImage(g2, area);
907    }
908
909    /**
910     * Fills the specified area with the background paint.
911     *
912     * @param g2  the graphics device.
913     * @param area  the area.
914     *
915     * @see #getBackgroundPaint()
916     * @see #getBackgroundAlpha()
917     * @see #fillBackground(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, PlotOrientation)
918     */
919    protected void fillBackground(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
920        fillBackground(g2, area, PlotOrientation.VERTICAL);
921    }
922
923    /**
924     * Fills the specified area with the background paint.  If the background
925     * paint is an instance of {@code GradientPaint}, the gradient will
926     * run in the direction suggested by the plot's orientation.
927     *
928     * @param g2  the graphics target.
929     * @param area  the plot area.
930     * @param orientation  the plot orientation ({@code null} not permitted).
931     */
932    protected void fillBackground(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area,
933            PlotOrientation orientation) {
934        Args.nullNotPermitted(orientation, "orientation");
935        if (this.backgroundPaint == null) {
936            return;
937        }
938        Paint p = this.backgroundPaint;
939        if (p instanceof GradientPaint) {
940            GradientPaint gp = (GradientPaint) p;
941            if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
942                p = new GradientPaint((float) area.getCenterX(),
943                        (float) area.getMaxY(), gp.getColor1(),
944                        (float) area.getCenterX(), (float) area.getMinY(),
945                        gp.getColor2());
946            }
947            else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
948                p = new GradientPaint((float) area.getMinX(),
949                        (float) area.getCenterY(), gp.getColor1(),
950                        (float) area.getMaxX(), (float) area.getCenterY(),
951                        gp.getColor2());
952            }
953        }
954        Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
955        g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
956                this.backgroundAlpha));
957        g2.setPaint(p);
958        g2.fill(area);
959        g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
960    }
961
962    /**
963     * Draws the background image (if there is one) aligned within the
964     * specified area.
965     *
966     * @param g2  the graphics device.
967     * @param area  the area.
968     *
969     * @see #getBackgroundImage()
970     * @see #getBackgroundImageAlignment()
971     * @see #getBackgroundImageAlpha()
972     */
973    public void drawBackgroundImage(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
974        plotProduct.drawBackgroundImage(g2, area);
975    }
976
977    /**
978     * Draws the plot outline.  This method will be called during the chart
979     * drawing process and is declared public so that it can be accessed by the
980     * renderers used by certain subclasses. You shouldn't need to call this
981     * method directly.
982     *
983     * @param g2  the graphics device.
984     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
985     */
986    public void drawOutline(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
987        if (!this.outlineVisible) {
988            return;
989        }
990        if ((this.outlineStroke != null) && (this.outlinePaint != null)) {
991            g2.setStroke(this.outlineStroke);
992            g2.setPaint(this.outlinePaint);
993            Object saved = g2.getRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL);
994            g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_NORMALIZE);
995            g2.draw(area);
996            g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, saved);
997        }
998    }
999
1000    /**
1001     * Draws a message to state that there is no data to plot.
1002     *
1003     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1004     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
1005     */
1006    protected void drawNoDataMessage(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
1007        Shape savedClip = g2.getClip();
1008        g2.clip(area);
1009        String message = this.noDataMessage;
1010        if (message != null) {
1011            g2.setFont(this.noDataMessageFont);
1012            g2.setPaint(this.noDataMessagePaint);
1013            TextBlock block = TextUtils.createTextBlock(
1014                    this.noDataMessage, this.noDataMessageFont,
1015                    this.noDataMessagePaint, 0.9f * (float) area.getWidth(),
1016                    new G2TextMeasurer(g2));
1017            block.draw(g2, (float) area.getCenterX(),
1018                    (float) area.getCenterY(), TextBlockAnchor.CENTER);
1019        }
1020        g2.setClip(savedClip);
1021    }
1022
1023    /**
1024     * Creates a plot entity that contains a reference to the plot and the
1025     * data area as shape.
1026     *
1027     * @param dataArea  the data area used as hot spot for the entity.
1028     * @param plotState  the plot rendering info containing a reference to the
1029     *     EntityCollection.
1030     * @param toolTip  the tool tip (defined in the respective Plot
1031     *     subclass) ({@code null} permitted).
1032     * @param urlText  the url (defined in the respective Plot subclass)
1033     *     ({@code null} permitted).
1034     */
1035    protected void createAndAddEntity(Rectangle2D dataArea,
1036            PlotRenderingInfo plotState, String toolTip, String urlText) {
1037        if (plotState != null && plotState.getOwner() != null) {
1038            EntityCollection e = plotState.getOwner().getEntityCollection();
1039            if (e != null) {
1040                e.add(new PlotEntity(dataArea, this, toolTip, urlText));
1041            }
1042        }
1043    }
1044
1045    /**
1046     * Handles a 'click' on the plot.  Since the plot does not maintain any
1047     * information about where it has been drawn, the plot rendering info is
1048     * supplied as an argument so that the plot dimensions can be determined.
1049     *
1050     * @param x  the x coordinate (in Java2D space).
1051     * @param y  the y coordinate (in Java2D space).
1052     * @param info  an object containing information about the dimensions of
1053     *              the plot.
1054     */
1055    public void handleClick(int x, int y, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
1056        // provides a 'no action' default
1057    }
1058
1059    /**
1060     * Performs a zoom on the plot.  Subclasses should override if zooming is
1061     * appropriate for the type of plot.
1062     *
1063     * @param percent  the zoom percentage.
1064     */
1065    public void zoom(double percent) {
1066        // do nothing by default.
1067    }

1069    /**
1070     * Receives notification of a change to an {@link Annotation} added to
1071     * this plot.
1072     *
1073     * @param event  information about the event (not used here).
1074     */
1075    @Override
1076    public void annotationChanged(AnnotationChangeEvent event) {
1077        fireChangeEvent();
1078    }
1079
1080    /**
1081     * Receives notification of a change to one of the plot's axes.
1082     *
1083     * @param event  information about the event (not used here).
1084     */
1085    @Override
1086    public void axisChanged(AxisChangeEvent event) {
1087        fireChangeEvent();
1088    }
1089
1090    /**
1091     * Receives notification of a change to the plot's dataset.
1092     * <P>
1093     * The plot reacts by passing on a plot change event to all registered
1094     * listeners.
1095     *
1096     * @param event  information about the event (not used here).
1097     */
1098    @Override
1099    public void datasetChanged(DatasetChangeEvent event) {
1100        PlotChangeEvent newEvent = new PlotChangeEvent(this);
1101        newEvent.setType(ChartChangeEventType.DATASET_UPDATED);
1102        plotProduct2.notifyListeners(newEvent, this);
1103    }
1104
1105    /**
1106     * Receives notification of a change to a marker that is assigned to the
1107     * plot.
1108     *
1109     * @param event  the event.
1110     */
1111    @Override
1112    public void markerChanged(MarkerChangeEvent event) {
1113        fireChangeEvent();
1114    }
1115
1116    /**
1117     * Adjusts the supplied x-value.
1118     *
1119     * @param x  the x-value.
1120     * @param w1  width 1.
1121     * @param w2  width 2.
1122     * @param edge  the edge (left or right).
1123     *
1124     * @return The adjusted x-value.
1125     */
1126    protected double getRectX(double x, double w1, double w2,
1127                              RectangleEdge edge) {
1128
1129        double result = x;
1130        if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
1131            result = result + w1;
1132        }
1133        else if (edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
1134            result = result + w2;
1135        }
1136        return result;
1137
1138    }
1139
1140    /**
1141     * Adjusts the supplied y-value.
1142     *
1143     * @param y  the x-value.
1144     * @param h1  height 1.
1145     * @param h2  height 2.
1146     * @param edge  the edge (top or bottom).
1147     *
1148     * @return The adjusted y-value.
1149     */
1150    protected double getRectY(double y, double h1, double h2,
1151                              RectangleEdge edge) {
1152
1153        double result = y;
1154        if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
1155            result = result + h1;
1156        }
1157        else if (edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
1158            result = result + h2;
1159        }
1160        return result;
1161
1162    }
1163
1164    /**
1165     * Tests this plot for equality with another object.
1166     *
1167     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1168     *
1169     * @return {@code true} or {@code false}.
1170     */
1171    @Override
1172    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1173        if (obj == this) {
1174            return true;
1175        }
1176        if (!(obj instanceof Plot)) {
1177            return false;
1178        }
1179        Plot that = (Plot) obj;
1180        if (!Objects.equals(this.noDataMessage, that.noDataMessage)) {
1181            return false;
1182        }
1183        if (!Objects.equals(this.noDataMessageFont, that.noDataMessageFont)) {
1184            return false;
1185        }
1186        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.noDataMessagePaint,
1187                that.noDataMessagePaint)) {
1188            return false;
1189        }
1190        if (!Objects.equals(this.insets, that.insets)) {
1191            return false;
1192        }
1193        if (this.outlineVisible != that.outlineVisible) {
1194            return false;
1195        }
1196        if (!Objects.equals(this.outlineStroke, that.outlineStroke)) {
1197            return false;
1198        }
1199        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.outlinePaint, that.outlinePaint)) {
1200            return false;
1201        }
1202        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.backgroundPaint, that.backgroundPaint)) {
1203            return false;
1204        }
1205        if (!Objects.equals(this.plotProduct.getBackgroundImage(), that.plotProduct.getBackgroundImage())) {
1206            return false;
1207        }
1208        if (this.plotProduct.getBackgroundImageAlignment() != that.plotProduct.getBackgroundImageAlignment()) {
1209            return false;
1210        }
1211        if (this.plotProduct.getBackgroundImageAlpha() != that.plotProduct.getBackgroundImageAlpha()) {
1212            return false;
1213        }
1214        if (this.foregroundAlpha != that.foregroundAlpha) {
1215            return false;
1216        }
1217        if (this.backgroundAlpha != that.backgroundAlpha) {
1218            return false;
1219        }
1220        if (!this.drawingSupplier.equals(that.drawingSupplier)) {
1221            return false;
1222        }
1223        if (this.notify != that.notify) {
1224            return false;
1225        }
1226        return true;
1227    }
1228
1229    /**
1230     * Creates a clone of the plot.
1231     *
1232     * @return A clone.
1233     *
1234     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if some component of the plot does not
1235     *         support cloning.
1236     */
1237    @Override
1238    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1239        Plot clone = (Plot) super.clone();
1240                clone.plotProduct2 = (PlotProduct2) this.plotProduct2.clone();
1241                clone.plotProduct = (PlotProduct) this.plotProduct.clone();
1242        // private Plot parent <-- don't clone the parent plot, but take care
1243        // childs in combined plots instead
1244        clone.drawingSupplier = CloneUtils.clone(this.drawingSupplier);
1245        clone.plotProduct2.setListenerList(new EventListenerList());
1246        return clone;
1247    }
1248
1249    /**
1250     * Provides serialization support.
1251     *
1252     * @param stream  the output stream.
1253     *
1254     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1255     */
1256    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1257        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1258                stream.writeObject(this.plotProduct2);
1259        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.noDataMessagePaint, stream);
1260        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.outlineStroke, stream);
1261        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.outlinePaint, stream);
1262        // backgroundImage
1263        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.backgroundPaint, stream);
1264    }
1265
1266    /**
1267     * Provides serialization support.
1268     *
1269     * @param stream  the input stream.
1270     *
1271     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1272     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1273     */
1274    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1275        throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1276        stream.defaultReadObject();
1277                this.plotProduct2 = (PlotProduct2) stream.readObject();
1278        this.noDataMessagePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1279        this.outlineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1280        this.outlinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1281        // backgroundImage
1282        this.backgroundPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1283
1284        plotProduct2.setListenerList(new EventListenerList());
1285
1286    }
1287
1288    /**
1289     * Resolves a domain axis location for a given plot orientation.
1290     *
1291     * @param location  the location ({@code null} not permitted).
1292     * @param orientation  the orientation ({@code null} not permitted).
1293     *
1294     * @return The edge (never {@code null}).
1295     */
1296    public static RectangleEdge resolveDomainAxisLocation(
1297            AxisLocation location, PlotOrientation orientation) {
1298
1299        Args.nullNotPermitted(location, "location");
1300        Args.nullNotPermitted(orientation, "orientation");
1301
1302        RectangleEdge result = null;
1303        switch (location) {
1304            case TOP_OR_RIGHT:
1305                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1306                    result = RectangleEdge.RIGHT;
1307                }
1308                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1309                    result = RectangleEdge.TOP;
1310                }   break;
1311            case TOP_OR_LEFT:
1312                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1313                    result = RectangleEdge.LEFT;
1314                }
1315                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1316                    result = RectangleEdge.TOP;
1317                }   break;
1318            case BOTTOM_OR_RIGHT:
1319                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1320                    result = RectangleEdge.RIGHT;
1321                }
1322                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1323                    result = RectangleEdge.BOTTOM;
1324                }   break;
1325            case BOTTOM_OR_LEFT:
1326                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1327                    result = RectangleEdge.LEFT;
1328                }
1329                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1330                    result = RectangleEdge.BOTTOM;
1331                }   break;
1332            default:
1333                break;
1334        }
1335        // the above should cover all the options...
1336        if (result == null) {
1337            throw new IllegalStateException("resolveDomainAxisLocation()");
1338        }
1339        return result;
1340
1341    }
1342
1343    /**
1344     * Resolves a range axis location for a given plot orientation.
1345     *
1346     * @param location  the location ({@code null} not permitted).
1347     * @param orientation  the orientation ({@code null} not permitted).
1348     *
1349     * @return The edge (never {@code null}).
1350     */
1351    public static RectangleEdge resolveRangeAxisLocation(
1352            AxisLocation location, PlotOrientation orientation) {
1353
1354        Args.nullNotPermitted(location, "location");
1355        Args.nullNotPermitted(orientation, "orientation");
1356
1357        RectangleEdge result = null;
1358        switch (location) {
1359            case TOP_OR_RIGHT:
1360                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1361                    result = RectangleEdge.TOP;
1362                }
1363                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1364                    result = RectangleEdge.RIGHT;
1365                }   break;
1366            case TOP_OR_LEFT:
1367                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1368                    result = RectangleEdge.TOP;
1369                }
1370                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1371                    result = RectangleEdge.LEFT;
1372                }   break;
1373            case BOTTOM_OR_RIGHT:
1374                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1375                    result = RectangleEdge.BOTTOM;
1376                }
1377                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1378                    result = RectangleEdge.RIGHT;
1379                }   break;
1380            case BOTTOM_OR_LEFT:
1381                if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1382                    result = RectangleEdge.BOTTOM;
1383                }
1384                else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1385                    result = RectangleEdge.LEFT;
1386                }   break;
1387            default:
1388                break;
1389        }
1390
1391        // the above should cover all the options...
1392        if (result == null) {
1393            throw new IllegalStateException("resolveRangeAxisLocation()");
1394        }
1395        return result;
1396
1397    }
1398
1399        public void setNotify2(boolean notify) {
1400                this.notify = notify;
1401        }
1402
1403}
